description.narrative: (Malawi): This activity supports the Government of Malawi's decentralization reforms by strengthening its capacity to plan, finance, manage, and deliver services in priority sectors (particularly health, education, and economic growth), while also deepening citizen engagement. With USAID's support, in 2019 the Government of Malawi conducted a nationwide performance assessment that established a firm connection between the capacity of local governments to implement core functions and the quality of services delivered at the district level. The same year, with support from the UK, LGAP expanded from an initial eight districts to cover all of Malawi's 28 districts. Today, the project is improving human resource and public financial management practices nationwide to increase local government accountability and service delivery. In FY 2020, bolstered by increased commitment from the newly elected Government of Malawi, LGAP will provide technical assistance for implementation of the public sector reform policy aimed at harmonizing legislation and policies while strengthening human resource and financial management systems. LGAP will also continue to improve the central government's audit and inspection functions of local government performance. These efforts are essential to ensure that both the Government of Malawi and U.S. government resources are being used effectively to promote Malawi's development and journey to self-reliance. Good Governance is a priority under Objectives 2.2 and 3.1 of the Joint Strategic Plan and Goal 3 of the Joint Regional Strategy. The National Security Strategy lists improved governance as a way to support economic growth and reduce illegal immigration and vulnerability to extremists. LGAP further contributes to the Malawi Integrated Country Strategy Goal 2: promote a more responsive, transparent, and accountable government.
